knimeNode.name: Mask Lists
knimeNode.shortDescription: This node applies a mask (from a List column) to one or more list columns

intro.p: This node creates a mask from a selected column, and only keeps the 'masked' subset of members of any selected lists. If the mask column is a collection of boolean cells or a BitVector cell, then the kept cells are those whose corresponding positions in the mask are 'true' (set bits in the case of a BitVector). If it is a list of integers, the mask is either those positions where the mask value > 0, or the list of indices within the list represented by the numerical values in the mask cell
This node was developed by Vernalis Research (Cambridge, UK) . For feedback and more information, please contact knime@vernalis.com

fullDescription.option: Select the incoming List column or BitVector containing the mask
If the mask is a list of integers, then use those values as the indices. If this option is not set, then those positions where the value > 0 will be used

option.name: Treat missing masks as empty collections

fullDescription.option: If this option is set, a missing cell in the mask column will be treated as an empty collection, otherwise the row will be left unmasked
The list columns to apply the mask to
Should the node execution fail if there are no matching collection columns?

ports.outPort: The input table with the masked lists
